title: Big twist in IPS officer 'suicide' case: Another Haryana cop shoots self; records final video
content: A Haryana police officer in Rohtak has allegedly committed suicide, accusing senior IPS officer Y Puran Kumar of corruption. Kumar himself reportedly died by suicide, leaving a note naming 16 senior IAS and IPS officers and alleging harassment as the cause for his extreme step.

title: Ahmedabad airport on high alert: Qatar Airways flight reports cabin pressure issue
content: A Qatar Airways flight from Doha to Hong Kong declared a full emergency over Indian airspace due to a sudden loss of cabin pressure. The Boeing 777, flight QR 816, made a safe emergency landing at Ahmedabad Airport. All passengers and crew were unharmed, and airport operations resumed shortly after.

title: 'I need one ... ': A rare instance of Gautam Gambhir cracking joke at India press conference
content: Former India cricketer Gautam Gambhir lightened up after a recent match. He humorously suggested he needs a mental conditioning coach given India's busy schedule. Gambhir also spoke about the team's batting and spin bowling. He highlighted the importance of adapting to different pitches. The upcoming series will test India's home strength.

title: 'China using these gadgets to spy on Americans', warns US agency
content: The FCC has issued a national security notice, warning that Chinese electronics pose a surveillance and security threat to Americans. Millions of prohibited product listings, including security cameras and smartwatches from companies like Huawei and Hikvision, have been removed from US retail platforms. This action is part of Washington's ongoing crackdown on Chinese technology firms due to national security concerns.

title: Cops remove JD(U) MLA Gopal Mandal from outside Nitish Kumar's house - watch
content: JD(U) MLA Gopal Mandal protested outside Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's residence. He demanded a party ticket for the Gopalpur assembly constituency. This protest highlights internal party issues regarding seat distribution for the upcoming Bihar elections. Other leaders have also expressed discontent. The NDA has finalised its seat-sharing formula. The party leadership projects unity ahead of the polls.

title: 'Stop using a kid to run your YouTube channel': Gambhir slams World Cup winner
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir defended young pacer Harshit Rana against criticism from K Srikkanth, calling the attacks on the 23-year-old unfair and shameful. Gambhir emphasized Rana's selection based on merit and urged critics to consider the mental impact on emerging players, highlighting the need for moral responsibility in commentary.

title: Tears, hugs, kisses: Emotional reunions mark return of Israeli hostages, Palestinian prisoners
content: Long-awaited reunions unfolded as Israel welcomed back its last remaining hostages held by Hamas for over two years, since October 7 attack. Simultaneously, Palestinians celebrated the release of nearly 2,000 prisoners under a Gaza ceasefire deal. These dual moments of relief and hope marked a significant milestone amid the ongoing regional conflict.

title: 'Hope is not a plan’: Oyo founder inspired by Jeff Bezos’ mantra
content: Oyo founder Ritesh Agarwal revealed that Amazon's Jeff Bezos inspired his business strategy with the quote 'Hope is not a plan.' Agarwal emphasized the importance of structured planning and risk assessment over blind optimism, a mindset that guided Oyo's growth from a startup to a global hospitality brand.

title: Dirty toilets at national highways? NHAI will add Rs 1000 to your FASTag to report it
content: The National Highways Authority of India is rewarding users Rs 1,000 in FASTag credit for reporting dirty toilets at toll plazas. Highway users can submit geo-tagged photos of unclean facilities via the 'Rajmargyatra' app until October 31, 2025. This initiative aims to improve cleanliness on national highways, with each vehicle registration number eligible for one reward during the scheme's duration.

title: Watch: After losing weight, Rohit leaves for Delhi; to join Gill-led India
content: Rohit Sharma, looking remarkably fit, has been spotted heading to Delhi for the upcoming ODI series in Australia. The 38-year-old's significant physical transformation is evident, following his recent success in the Champions Trophy. Sharma successfully cleared his pre-season fitness assessments, including the Yo-Yo test and DXA scan, at the BCCI Centre of Excellence.

title: DJ Moore injury scare: Bears star leaves in ambulance after 25-24 win
content: Chicago Bears wide receiver DJ Moore was taken to the hospital via ambulance after sustaining an injury during the Week 6 game against the Commanders. He was reportedly pushed from behind while carrying the ball, leading to a hard landing on his hip. Moore is expected to stay overnight for observation, despite appearing to be in good spirits post-game.

title: Digital rights debate: SC rejects doctor’s WhatsApp plea; suggests using Zoho’s Arattai
content: India's Supreme Court has ruled that access to private messaging platforms like WhatsApp is not a fundamental right. The court dismissed a doctor's plea to restore her blocked account, emphasizing users must adhere to platform policies. It suggested alternatives like Zoho's Arattai app, which has seen a surge in popularity.

title: Musk backs Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff’s call to deploy troops in San Francisco
content: Tech leaders Marc Benioff and Elon Musk have voiced support for Donald Trump's proposal to deploy federal troops in San Francisco to combat crime and drug trafficking. This backing comes amid local advocacy citing voter support for federal intervention and concerning statistics on fentanyl seizures and overdose deaths.

title: One-sided contests: Can promotion and relegation save Test cricket? A case for two-tier WTC
content: Test cricket faces a crossroads. Mismatched contests, financial strain, and dwindling competitiveness threaten the format. A two-tier system, with promotion, relegation, and centralized revenue, may just be the lifeline the longest format needs — giving top teams fierce contests while nurturing emerging nations for the future.

title: JPMorgan's $1.5 tn plan: CEO Jamie Dimon plans to hire more experts
content: JPMorgan Chase is launching a $1.5 trillion, 10-year initiative to bolster US industries vital for national security and economic growth. The bank will invest up to $10 billion in companies across defense, energy, manufacturing, and emerging technologies, aiming to strengthen supply chains and energy independence.

title: Maharashtra Maoist chief surrenders: Mallojula Venugopal Rao, 62 cadres lay down arms
content: Senior Maoist leader Mallojula Venugopal Rao, alias Sonu 'Bhupati', surrendered with 62 cadres and 54 weapons in Gadchiroli, Maharashtra. This event signals the potential end of the state's five-decade-long Maoist insurgency, following a siege of the guerrilla headquarters. The surrender bolsters the Union Home Minister's vision for a Naxal-free India.

title: Low magnesium: The silent cause behind your poor sleep, anxiety and fatigue
content: Millions of people worldwide struggle with low magnesium, often without realizing it. The deficiency can lead to poor sleep, anxiety, and fatigue. It’s one of the most overlooked nutrients today.

title: Bihar elections: Sharjeel Imam withdraws interim bail plea; had moved to contest polls
content: JNU student activist Sharjeel Imam withdrew his interim bail plea from a Karkardooma court to contest Bihar assembly elections. His lawyer argued the Supreme Court is the appropriate forum, as a regular bail plea is pending there. Imam sought bail to run as an independent from Bahadurganj, citing his status as a "political prisoner."

title: Bihar polls: INDIA bloc fields Sushant Singh Rajput’s cousin Divya Gautam from Digha seat
content: Sushant Singh Rajput's cousin, Divya Gautam, a former Patna University Students' Union candidate and stage artist, will represent the INDIA bloc from Digha in Bihar's assembly elections.  The CPI-ML is fielding her against BJP's sitting MLA Sanjeev Chaurasia.  Divya, an alumna of Patna University and a PhD scholar, brings a fresh political challenge to the large Digha constituency.

title: Roads not safe: State must pay Rs 6L for pothole, manhole deaths, rules Bombay HC
content: Bombay High Court has mandated municipal corporations and state authorities to pay Rs 6 lakh compensation for pothole-related deaths and Rs 50,000 to Rs 2.5 lakh for injuries. Committees will be formed to determine compensation, with payments to be disbursed within six to eight weeks. Strict action will be taken against responsible officers and contractors.

title: Pichai speaks to PM Modi, Google to invest $15 bn in AI hub at Visakhapatnam
content: Google is set to invest a massive $15 billion over five years to establish its first AI hub in Visakhapatnam. This significant development, announced in New Delhi, will feature immense computing power, a new subsea gateway, and robust energy infrastructure.  The hub aims to accelerate AI innovation and drive growth across India by providing cutting-edge technology and local data solutions.

title: UPI in Japan soon! NPCI International signs MoU with NTT DATA; check full list
content: Indian tourists visiting Japan will soon be able to use UPI for payments following a deal between NPCI International and NTT DATA. This partnership will allow travelers to scan QR codes with their UPI apps at merchant locations managed by NTT DATA, offering a familiar and seamless digital payment experience.

title: CBSE reminder to schools: Submit Class 9, 11 registration data; deadline Oct 16
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has issued a fourth reminder to affiliated schools to submit registration data for Class 9 and 11 students for the 2025–26 session by October 16. Schools must ensure accuracy in student details and subjects offered. CBSE has warned that errors or delays may lead to administrative complications.

title: Bihar polls: Lalu distributes tickets to RJD loyalists; Tejashwi reverses move late night
content: Despite the approaching nomination deadline for Bihar assembly elections, the Mahagathbandhan has not yet finalized its seat-sharing deal. RJD patriarch Lalu Prasad Yadav has begun distributing party tickets to favored candidates, including prominent leaders who switched parties. This move follows a similar pattern from the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, where RJD also announced candidates before a formal agreement.

title: 'Why are roads so bad?': Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw slams Bengaluru infra again
content: Biocon Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw highlighted Bengaluru's poor roads and garbage issues after an overseas visitor's critique. Karnataka ministers responded, stating development work is underway. The state's Deputy Chief Minister attributed pothole problems to the previous government. This infrastructure debate continues between political parties.

title: Viral selfie video, arrest, party war: How Chennai murder ignited political storm in Andhra Pradesh
content: A viral selfie video of a deceased driver has reignited a political feud between suspended Jana Sena leader Vinutha Kota and TDP MLA Bojjala Sudheer Reddy. The video alleges Reddy's associates paid the driver for information on Kota, who was previously arrested and granted bail in the driver's murder case.

title: ‘Calls filled with threats…’: Priyank Kharge faces abuse over RSS remarks
content: Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge reported receiving threats and abuse for questioning RSS activities in government institutions. He cited historical figures like Gandhi and Ambedkar in his defense, advocating for a society based on equality and reason. The state government is reviewing a similar ban implemented in Tamil Nadu.

title: 'End this drama': Rahul Gandhi meets Haryana IPS officer's wife, daughters
content: Rahul Gandhi urged Prime Minister Modi and Haryana CM Saini to arrest accused police officers in the IPS officer's suicide case, citing unfulfilled commitments for a fair inquiry. Politicians are visiting the grieving family, with Union Minister Ramdas Athawale assuring support and emphasizing the SC community's expectation of action.

title: Durgapur gang-rape case: Bengal BJP launches ‘Operation Lal Mirch’
content: West Bengal BJP workers launched 'Operation Lal Mirch', distributing red chilli powder to women for self-defence amid rising crime. This initiative follows a recent gang rape in Durgapur. Protesters criticized the Chief Minister's remarks on women's safety, deeming them an admission of government failure.

title: King is back! Virat Kohli surrounded by fans in Delhi as he returns to India - Watch
content: Virat Kohli has returned to India after a four-month break, rejoining the ODI squad for their upcoming tour of Australia. This marks his return to international cricket since the Champions Trophy, with his performance in this series crucial amid speculation about his future. The team departs for Perth on October 15.

title: Suicides surge in IITs, IIMs: Will SC intervention put safety before reputation?
content: India's top colleges face a crisis as student suicides surge, prompting Supreme Court intervention. A national task force is investigating the alarming rise, with over 98 deaths since 2018. Despite a nationwide survey, many institutions remain unresponsive, risking legal action. Reforms are urgently needed to address academic and social pressures impacting student well-being.

title: Premanand Ji Maharaj health update: Video shows him laughing; devotees relieved
content: Speculation surrounding Premanand Ji Maharaj's health caused concern among devotees. A recent viral video showing the saint smiling and laughing has brought immense relief and joy to his followers, reaffirming his spiritual presence and offering a beacon of hope.

title: ‘Very big on India’: IMF chief heaps praise on India’s ‘bold’ reforms; says it proved doubters wrong
content: IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva expressed strong optimism about India's economic prospects, highlighting its bold reforms like digital identity and GST. She praised India for proving doubters wrong with its digital approach and structural changes.

title: Monkeys, power cuts & leaks: How India hosted chess nationals
content: While the US Chess Championship showcased professional player treatment with an umbrella for sunlight, India's National Championship faced chaos. Players endured monkeys, power cuts, and leaking tents, highlighting poor playing conditions. This stark contrast raises concerns about India's ability to host major chess events, despite its growing chess prowess.

title: 'Warned multiple times': Maoists kill BJP worker in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
content: A BJP worker was strangled to death by Naxalites in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, with the Maoist group claiming he was a police informer. This killing, attributed to the Madded area committee, marks another fatality in the Bastar division, where nearly 40 have died from Maoist violence this year.

title: 5 everyday exercise that can help to improve heart health
content: Keeping your heart healthy is vital for overall well-being. Regular exercise strengthens your heart muscle, improves blood flow, and lowers blood pressure. Activities like brisk walking, swimming, and strength training are beneficial. Even daily movements like climbing stairs contribute to a strong heart. Consistency and safety are key to reaping these rewards and enhancing your energy and stamina.

title: Ghaziabad techie falls to death from 31st floor while inspecting flat
content: A 25-year-old software engineer tragically died after falling from the 31st floor of a high-rise in Indirapuram on Sunday evening. While inspecting a rental flat with his friend and a property agent, he went to the master bedroom to take a private call.

title: Delhi horror: Woman burns 5-year-old stepdaughter with electric iron
content: A woman in her 30s has been booked for allegedly burning her five-year-old stepdaughter with an electric iron in central Delhi. The girl's father reported the incident after finding her with severe burn injuries on her legs. The child reportedly identified her stepmother as the perpetrator.

title: Why Indians face a Vitamin D crisis even with so much sun
content: Despite India’s abundant sunlight, nearly 9 in 10 people are Vitamin D deficient. Indoor lifestyles, pollution, and sunscreen use block UVB rays, quietly affecting mood, bones, and immunity.

title: 'Hang them': Father of BTech grad 'beaten to death' by MP cops seeks justice
content: A BTech graduate's death following alleged police brutality has sparked outrage in Bhopal. The victim's family questions the FIR's omission of a Rs 10,000 bribe demand by constables, who are accused of assaulting the youth after he collected his degree. A murder case has been registered, and the constables arrested.

title: Haryana IPS officer’s suicide: Nayab govt’s one-year celebration put on hold
content: A major rally in Sonipat celebrating one year of the Nayab Singh Saini government, which was to feature Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has been postponed. The decision comes amid escalating tensions and protests following the alleged casteist harassment leading to the suicide of IPS officer Y Puran Kumar.

title: Bihar polls: JD(U) MLA sits outside CM Nitish's house over ticket; refuses to move
content: A JD(U) MLA staged a protest outside Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's residence, demanding an election ticket for Gopalpur. The legislator, known for past controversies including a train incident and accusations against a deputy CM, vowed not to leave without securing the nomination. This action highlights internal party tensions amid seat-sharing finalizations.

title: Bears' Jake Moody connects on field goal as time expires to beat Commanders
content: With Cairo Santos sidelined, Moody was activated before the game and came up big when it mattered most.

title: Bears' Moody caps whirlwind day with walk-off FG
content: Jake Moody was elevated from the practice squad just seven hours before nailing a 38-yard field goal as time expired to beat the Commanders 25-24 on Monday night.

title: Larsen-like Snell silences Brewers in Game 1 win
content: Blake Snell led the Dodgers to a 2-1 Game 1 victory in the NLCS against the Brewers, pitching his way into the kind of company he knew he'd be keeping when he signed with L.A. before the season.

title: Brewers turn MLB's 1st playoff 8-6-2 double play
content: The Brewers pulled off the first 8-6-2 double play in MLB postseason history against the Dodgers in Game 1 of the NLCS on Monday night.

title: QB Penix: Win over Bills shows Falcons are 'legit'
content: The Falcons showed they were a "legit" playoff contender after a 24-14 win over the Bills on Monday Night Football

title: M's take two in Toronto for commanding ALCS lead
content: Julio Rodriguez and Jorge Polanco each hit three-run homers as the Seattle Mariners drew to within two wins of the franchise's first World Series appearance.

title: Titans fire Callahan, to give McCoy shot at job
content: The Titans have fired Brian Callahan just six games into his second season as the team's head coach. He finishes with a 4-19 record as the team's coach.

title: McDermott: Bills must use bye week to start over
content: With Monday night's loss to the Falcons, the banged-up Bills enter their bye week on a two-game losing streak after a 4-0 start.

title: Turang: Dodging would-be HBP 'natural reaction'
content: Milwaukee's Brice Turang was inches from wearing a game-tying hit by pitch in Game 1 of the NLCS on Monday night -- but reflex caused him to back away.

title: Passan: Jorge Polanco has the Mariners on the way to a Hollywood ending
content: Harry Potter, Iceman ... or George Bonds? Whatever you call him, Jorge Polanco has the Mariners rolling.

title: Judging the MLB playoffs: The team to beat, who has the vibes to stop them and this October's top ace
content: We hand out verdicts on how real -- or not real -- the biggest storylines are of this postseason so far.

title: NFL Week 7 Power Rankings: Our 1-32 poll, plus the biggest lessons learned so far for every team
content: We reshuffled the teams in our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 7. Plus, here are the biggest lessons for each roster so far this season.

title: Takeaways from Week 6: Robinson shines for Falcons, Moody kicks Bears to victory
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 6.

title: NHL Rank: From 1 to 100, who will be the best players in 2025-26?
content: Connor McDavid remains No. 1, but who lands after? Here's who the ESPN panel believes is best for this season.

title: 'Pretty darn impressive': Alex Ovechkin still wowing teammates amid uncertain future
content: After Ovi broke Wayne Gretzky's record, his teammates expect more of the same in the final year of his deal.

title: Let's simulate the entire NBA season: How the biggest storylines could unfold
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton used simulation No. 620 to run through the NBA season from Opening Night to the Finals.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do at midseason
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the playoff picture takes shape.

title: The rise of Curt Cignetti, the fall of James Franklin and other midseason thoughts
content: Bill Connelly looks at both ends of the coaching world, plus the top players, the Heisman race and more.

title: Kiper's debut 2026 Big Board: Ranking the top 25 NFL draft prospects, plus position reports
content: Mel Kiper Jr. is stacking the top 25 players for the 2026 NFL draft, including four quarterbacks and one really good running back. See who makes the list.

title: Opening night or late-season debuts? Key NBA superstar injury returns to watch for
content: From opening night to late season debuts, here are the biggest superstar injury returns to watch for in the 2025-26 NBA season.

title: Ranking every championship team: 2023 Aces are No. 1
content: Las Vegas' 2023 title team topped our rankings two years ago. Where do the 2025 Aces and 2024 Liberty fit in?

title: CBA negotiations: Everything to know with deadline looming
content: Here are the biggest issues and how players' criticisms of Cathy Engelbert might impact negotiations.

title: Bracketology: Finally, some qualitative data to add to the projections
content: Could a procedural advantage be the difference in Houston finally winning a national title? Plus, the newest teams joining the field of 68.

title: First bets for Week 7: Buccaneers' luck runs out vs. Lions, Giants cover in Denver
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are five early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: How USMNT, USWNT choose opponents, venues and prices for games
content: USMNT and USWNT fans often complain about high ticket prices, repetitive cities and weak opponents for games, but U.S. Soccer explains everything that goes into such decisions.

title: The tiny island nation that's two wins from a World Cup spot
content: Meet the team of part-timers, ranked 150 by FIFA, hoping to reach next summer's tournament. "Every young boy wants to play in a World Cup, it is a dream... and we know we have a chance."

title: Pickups: Vidal steps up; Dart, Darnold being underrated
content: Highlighting free agent options after some big performances this weekend and to help with injury concerns ahead of Week 7.

title: Checking the temperature of the NFL's hottest seats: Barnwell on Mike McDaniel, Justin Fields
content: Should the Dolphins or Ravens make coaching changes? Is it time for a QB switch for the Jets? Might the Eagles consider moves in their secondary?

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: The Vision is blurred
content: Seth Rollins was blindsided when The Vision teammates Bron Breakker and Bronson Reed betrayed him at 'Raw.'

title: Transfer rumors, news: Neymar eyeing shock return to Europe
content: Santos forward Neymar is open to a move to Serie A amid links to Inter Milan and Napoli. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Manipur's law and order situation improved after imposition of President's Rule: Ex-CM Biren
content: “One party earlier constantly said that the government must be ousted; now they are demanding the dissolution of the assembly. We are not going to do what that party wills, we will pursue what the people want,” Former CM Biren Singh said

title: M.P. school principal hits Class 1 boy with plastic pipe for failing to recite table of 2; booked
content: “When the child’s mother was changing his clothes, she noticed injury marks on both his thighs as well as face”

title: Why Gen Z in Chennai is celebrating the world of analogue
content: Many things today unfold in fast, fleeting moments. Yet Gen Zers are indulging in the art of doing things by hand, not entirely for vintage appeal or nostalgia, but for the slowness of it, seeking texture and character in an otherwise monotonous world

title: Chellanam families return to abandoned homes, trusting government’s promise of second-phase tetrapod seawall construction
content: ₹306-crore 3.60-km tetrapod seawall project will stretch from Puthenthode to Cheriyakkadavu in Chellanam

title: After two-month suspension, India Post restores U.S. link with new duty system
content: The suspension had affected small exporters, particularly those dealing in handicrafts, textiles, and online merchandise, who rely on India Post as a low-cost shipping option

title: Tsunami mock drills on October 15 and November 5
content: The exercise aims to enhance tsunami preparedness, assess response capabilities across participating nations, and strengthen regional coordination

title: K. Muraleedharan slams Centre and State over Sabarimala gold theft, launches march from Kanhangad
content: UDF on October 14 launches three regional marches, while another will begin from Muvattupuzha on October 15. All four will converge at Chengannur on October 17, followed by a rally on October 18

title: 266 Maoists arrested, 32 killed, 30 surrendered in Jharkhand during January-September period: Police
content: A total of 128 FIRs has been filed against cybercriminals, and 105 individuals have been arrested for such crimes in August and September

title: Indian envoy discusses bilateral ties with Sri Lanka’s ruling JVP official
content: The duo exchanged ‘views on the limitless potential of closer economic ties for mutual prosperity of the people of India and Sri Lanka’, says report

title: Haryana ASI found dead in Rohtak; accuses deceased IPS officer Puran Kumar of corruption
content: An alleged note, along with a six-minute video, left behind by the deceased has made serious corruption allegations against the deceased IPS officer Puran Kumar and his family

title: Karnataka Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy slams Mohandas Pai and Tejasvi Surya’s call to privatise BMTC, says public transport must remain service-oriented
content: Says people proposing such ideas ‘have never travelled by public transport’ and ‘lack basic understanding of how it functions’

title: KMUT supported beneficiaries with food, medicines, and children’s education: State Planning Commission report
content: The report on the impact assessment of KMUT was submitted to Chief Minister M.K. Stalin by SPC ex-officio vice-chairperson Udhayanidhi Stalin and SPC executive vice-chairperson J. Jeyaranjan in Chennai on Tuesday

title: Manipur’s Ukhrul prepares for Thuingaleng Muivah’s homecoming after 55 years
content: Earlier attempts by the general secretary of the National Socialist Council of Nagalim to return to his village, Somdal, had been thwarted

title: Minister gets into crowd management as more than 6.4 lakh persons visit Hasanamba temple in Hassan for annual festival since October 10
content: The Minister announced that more than 2.29 lakh devotees visited the temple in the 24 hours that ended at 5 a.m. on October 14

title: Raebareli lynching: Two more arrested in the case
content: According to a statement issued by the Raebareli police, the two arrested have been identified as Chhotu alias Sujeet Agrahari and Avinesh Singh alias Saurabh Singh Baghel

title: Some nations openly violating global norms: Rajnath Singh
content: ‘We cannot fight today’s challenges with outdated multilateral structures. Without comprehensive reforms, the U.N. faces a crisis of confidence,’ says Defence Minister Rajnath Singh

title: State Planning Commission report on startups calls for simplifying funding processes
content: The report also called for strengthening the talent ecosystem and support systems, reinforcing social and spatial inclusion, and leveraging best practices

title: Supreme Court adjourns to October 15 hearing on plea by Sonam Wangchuk’s wife alleging mala fide detention
content: The petition argues that Sonam Wanchuk’s detention is arbitrary and demonstrates mala fide intent to suppress democratic dissent

title: Bihar Assembly elections: BJP releases first list of 71 candidates
content: Bihar Legislative Assembly Speaker Nand Kishore Yadav is among the prominent leaders missed in the list

title: Miffed with not being consulted for Assembly ticket distribution, JD(U) MP Ajay Kumar Mandal offers to resign
content: Ajay Kumar Mandal has posted the two-page letter on his social media account Facebook saying Assembly tickets are being given to individuals who have never worked for the party and organisation

title: Unorganised workers demand resolution in T.N. Assembly to repeal Centre’s four labour codes
content: The workers staged a day-long hunger strike in Chennai; their core demand was the repeal of the four labour codes — on Wages; Industrial Relations; Social Security; and Occupational Safety, Health, and Working Conditions

title: Bengal BJP distributes red chilli powder among women to protest Durgapur gang rape
content: ‘We have to protect ourselves, and must use red chilli powder and pepper sprays if necessary,’ says a woman BJP worker

title: Argentina-Australia friendly football match to be played in Kochi on November 17
content: Date officially confirmed by Argentine Football Association, say sponsors. Ticket fares to be announced soon

title: One arrested as Punjab Police busts illegal weapon smuggling module
content: Police recovered six pistols, 11 magazines and 111 live cartridges from the accused, Amarbir Singh, says police

title: SIT probe into ‘misappropriation’ of gold-plated Sabarimala artefacts extends to Hyderabad
content: Officials say SIT appears to have preliminary evidence that gold-inlaid copper overlays covering stone carvings and sculptures of the temple were possibly kept at the house of a wealthy Ayyappa devotee in Hyderabad

title: V.D. Satheesan questions if ED summons to Kerala CM’s son was behind ‘CPI(M)-BJP nexus’ during Lok Sabha polls
content: Opposition Leader demands transparency, alleges political cover-up in alleged Sabarimala gold theft and idol sale cases

title: Watch: Cabinet considers PF pension hike; EPFO simplifies withdrawals
content: The Cabinet is considering raising the minimum PF pension, offering crucial relief to workers. EPFO has simplified partial withdrawals, merged complex rules, and launched the Vishwas Scheme to cut litigation.

title: We love the way research translates into impact in India: Hugh Brady
content: Hugh Brady, President, Imperial College, London, spoke The Hindu about the new partnership between the college and Science Gallery Bengaluru

title: Madras High Court reserves orders on retired IPS officer’s plea to reject M.S. Dhoni’s ₹100-crore defamation suit
content: A Division Bench of Justices S.M. Subramaniam and M. Jothiraman defer their verdict on the appeal filed against a single judge’s 2021 order

title: Sikkim Govt issues advisory on depiction of religious deities in tattoos
content: Sikkim issued a warning against ‘objectionable’ depiction of religious deities after the International Tattoo Convention

title: Major explosives haul from Maoist hideout in Chhattisgarh
content: Anti-Maoist operation in Karreguta hills seizes explosives, foiling Maoists’ plans, and ensures safe return of security personnel

title: Hectic political developments in poll-bound Bihar as parties struggle to finalise seat-sharing
content: Some RJD leaders were seen at former CM Rabri Devi’s 10, Circular Road residence — where Tejashwi Yadav spends most of the time — to return their party symbols that had been issued for their election nominations

title: Google to invest ₹87,520 crore in AI Data Centre in Visakhapatnam
content: The data centre will have a capacity of one gigawatt and will be connected via subsea cable links to Singapore, Malaysia, Australia, and 12 other countries, positioning Visakhapatnam as a global connectivity hub

title: NCB Southern Region gets new Deputy Director-General
content: R. Sudhakar is presently the central anti-drug agency’s DDG, North East Region, stationed at Guwahati

title: Maharashtra State Election Commission requests ECI to postpone SIR in State until January 2026 due to local body elections
content: The State Election Commission said that field officers needed for the SIR will be involved in the local body elections and urges the ECI to defer the SIR till January 2026

title: Stones hurled at Shia cleric Maulana Kalbe Jawad in Lucknow
content: Shia cleric Maulana Kalbe Jawad and his supporters staged a protest at the site, accusing police of negligence

title: 4-storey chemical factory in Indore gutted in fire; no casualty
content: Fire officer Vinod Mishra said the blaze was so severe that fire engines and firefighters were called in from Indore as well as nearby towns like Depalpur, Betma, Mhow, Pithampur and Sanwer to control it.

title: MP Mallu Ravi urges PM for committee to identify systemic challenges faced by Dalits
content: The Congress MP also urged for action against those responsible for the incidents and a review of institutional safeguards

title: Passenger injured in stone-pelting at train in Kerala’s Kannur
content: Passenger suffers hand injury when a stone struck him while he was seated by the window. The display screen of his mobile phone is also damaged

title: After Transport Minister faces aggressive honking, Kerala launches Statewide crackdown on high-decibel air horns
content: Minister Ganesh Kumar orders MVD officials to confiscate air horns from vehicles and destroy them publicly to send a clear message to wrongdoers

title: Watch: India’s unsung forest heroes: the Van Rakshaks protecting our wild
content: A new Wildlife Trust of India report, “Guardians of the Wild,” highlights the courage and sacrifices of Van Rakshaks, the nation’s frontline forest guards. Guarding over 1,100 Protected Areas, these rangers work under dangerous and under-equipped conditions, with India recording the world’s highest number of forest staff fatalities. Released at the IUCN World Conservation Congress in Abu Dhabi, the report is a call to recognise and protect those who guard India’s forests, the true guardians of the wild

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly adopts resolution mourning Karur stampede victims
content: The House also adopts condolence resolutions mourning the passing of Achuthanandan, Soren, Ganesan, Reddy, and others

title: Durgapur gang rape: Five accused, friend of survivor taken to crime spot for reconstruction
content: Before coming for the reconstruction of the crime, investigating officers questioned the survivor’s friend for nearly an hour, police said.

title: WazirX restructuring scheme officially approved by Singapore High Court
content: The news is a source of relief for many distraught Indian investors whose locked up crypto assets are stuck with the exchange, while others are pushing for WazirX operations to resume quickly

title: Achieving Centre’s rooftop solar targets to remain a challenge: study
content: As of July 2025 – until which the report tracked progress – the PMSGY had 57.9 lakh applications for residential rooftop solar installations

title: South Asian University student sexually assaulted in Delhi, FIR registered
content: As the news about the alleged sexual assault broke on Monday, October 13, evening, students gathered at the administrative block, accusing the university of insensitivity and delay in informing the police.

title: Sonam Wangchuk case LIVE: SC adjourns to Oct. 15 hearing on plea of Wangchuk’s wife challenging his detention
content: A bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and N.V. Anjaria posted the matter for hearing on Wednesday (October 15, 2025) due to paucity of time.

title: Dharwad district secretary upset with delay in preparing project estimate, orders issue of show cause notice to executive engineer
content: Ram Prasath Manohar takes serious exception to failure of executive engineer of Panchayat Raj Engineering Department

title: Tension at Peralassery in Kerala’s Kannur as bomb thrown at woman’s house linked to BJP office
content: The attack occurred ahead of scheduled inauguration of BJP office on Peralassery temple road on Wednesday

title: At UNGA, Nishikant Dubey slams Pakistan over child rights violations
content: The BJP MP described Pakistan as "one of the worst violators of the UN's CAC (Children and Armed Conflict) agenda" and pointed out serious issues not just within Pakistan but also in neighbouring regions

title: Odisha CM assures Durgapur gang rape survivor of full support
content: The Chief Minister also spoke to the survivor's mother and Odisha State Commission for Women (OSCW) chairperson Shovana Mohanty, who was present at the hospital

title: Electricity consumers’ convention to be held in Bengaluru on October 26
content: All India Electricity Consumers’ Association (AIECA) has organised South India zone electricity consumers’ convention in Bengaluru on October 26, opposing privatisation of power sector and to press for various demands

title: WHO issues medical product alert on three contaminated oral liquid medicines in India
content: The contaminated oral liquid medicines have been identified to be specific batches of COLDRIF, Respifresh TR and ReLife, manufactured by Sresan Pharmaceutical, Rednex Pharmaceuticals, and Shape Pharma

title: Militant arrested, arms and ammunition seized in Manipur
content: Security forces arrested an active cadre of the proscribed Kangleipak Communist Party (PWG) outfit from Patsoi area in Imphal West district. He has been identified as 24-year-old Naorem Thembung, a police statement said

title: TDP MLA demands SIT probe into murder of suspended JSP leader’s driver in Srikalahasti
content: Expressing suspicion over the veracity of a ‘selfie video’ of the deceased, Venkata Sudheer Reddy says that it could have been generated by using computer graphics or AI tools

title: Rajasthan’s conviction rate up 18% after implementation of new laws, says Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said the three laws would bring “ease of justice” with the reforms in the criminal justice system and a shift in focus away from the punitive approach

title: Haryana IPS officer death: DGP sent on leave; Rahul Gandhi says ‘no action against accused sends wrong message going to Dalits’
content: The Chandigarh Police has asked the Haryana government to provide documents required for the investigation of the case; the SIT sent a request letter to Puran Kumar’s wife, urging her ‘to come forward for identification of the body for the conduct of the PME (post mortem) at the earliest’

title: NITI Aayog report moots policy changes for fisheries sector
content: All subsidies should be kept to a minimum, applied for a limited period, and phased out as soon as possible, the report on ‘India’s Blue Economy: Strategy for Harnessing Deep-Sea and Offshore Fisheries’ said

title: Bhubaneswar has stray dogs significantly higher than national average
content: As per census outcome, there are currently 47,126 stray dogs in Bhubaneswar - 36 per 1000 human against national average of 11

title: Nearly 57,000 institutes yet to survey student suicides, mental health on campuses
content: The National Task Force was constituted by the Court earlier this year after the parents of multiple students who had died by suicide approached the Supreme Court of India

title: ‘India endowed with 95 minerals, but yet to establish a footprint in critical minerals’
content: Prof Subramanian said, IISc has successfully translated basic research around critical minerals into industry-scale solutions

title: Final hearing on December 4 on PIL plea against ban on books: J&K High Court
content: Bench tells CPI(M) leader Tarigami: “Most people would not understand the issue. How would you know that all the people are concerned? So, no notices will be issued”

title: Our early warning systems are not luxury but strategic investments, says India at G20 meet on disaster risk reduction
content: Principal Secretary to Prime Minister P.K. Mishra says India’s multi-agency architecture on disaster risk alerts has already issued over 109 billion alerts.

title: Naidu invites Modi for ‘Super GST – Super Savings’ event in Kurnool and CII Partnership Summit in Vizag
content: The Prime Minister’s participation in the CII Partnership Summit 2025 will inspire investors to strengthen India’s economic resurgence, says the Chief Minister

title: Minister Kirti Vardhan Singh attends Gaza Peace Summit, reaffirms India's support for peace plan
content: The Gaza peace summit was co-hosted by U.S. President Donald Trump and Egyptian President Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi and was joined by several world leaders

title: In a show of strength in Eknath Shinde’s fortress, Shiv Sena UBT and MNS hold a joint rally in Thane
content: Both parties, along with Sharad Pawar’s NCP, staged a protest against alleged corruption and mismanagement in Thane Municipal Corporation

title: India-Australia joint military exercise AUSTRAHIND begins in Perth
content: Being held from October 13 to 26, this year’s edition focuses on counter-terrorism operations in urban and semi-urban terrain, reflecting the evolving nature of modern conflict, says the Indian Army.

title: Bulk LPG transporters strike: oil marketing companies continue to manage supplies in State
content: A senior official of an OMC says the is no need to panic as all three companies have enough cylinders in stock

title: Hyderabad’s revamped ‘corporate-style’ government school turning heads
content: Built at a cost of ₹7.7 crore, the new-look Government Primary and High School at Irrum Manzil stands out with its sleek architecture, landscaped surroundings, and modern facilities

title: Congress to boycott JPC on Bills to sack PM, CMs
content: The Lok Sabha had passed a resolution to refer the bills to the joint committee soon after Union Home Minister Amit Shah had introduced the bill in the Lower House on August 20

title: Bipin Joshi killed: Nepali hostage declared dead; Hamas hands over body to Israel
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Instagram Says It Is Safeguarding Teenagers By Limiting Them To PG-13 Content
content: Teenagers on Instagram will be restricted to seeing PG-13 content by default and won't be able to change their settings without a parent's permission, Meta announced on Tuesday.

title: Indian-Origin Man, Wrongfully Jailed For 43 Years, Faces Deportation From US
content: Subramanyam Vedam, a permanent US resident who came to the US from India as a nine-month-old baby, was convicted for the 1980 killing of 19-year-old Thomas Kinser in Pennsylvania.

title: Key Maoist Leader, Carrying Rs 6 Crore Prize, Surrenders In Maharashtra
content: One of the most wanted Maoists, who goes carries a bounty of Rs 6 crore on his head, surrendered before the police in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district along with 60 cadres.

title: UN, Red Cross Demand Opening Of All Gaza Crossings To Allow In Aid
content: The United Nations and Red Cross called for all crossings into Gaza to be opened to allow desperately needed aid into the war-torn Palestinian territory.

title: Singer Maithili Thakur Joins BJP, May Contest Bihar Polls From Alinagar
content: Celebrated Maithili folk singer Maithili Thakur joined the BJP today. Sources said she is expected to contest the coming assembly election from Alinagar.

title: COVID-19 May Change Offspring's Brain Development, Study In Mice Finds
content: Changes in sperm caused by COVID-19 in a mouse could affect the offspring's brain development and cause anxious behaviours, a study has found.

title: Adani Group's Return Of Assets Hits 16.5%, Among Highest Globally In Infrastructure: Gautam Adani
content: Adani Group chairman Gautam Adani said the conglomerate's return on assets (ROA) rose to 16.5 per cent in the financial year 2024-25 -- placing it among the top performers in the global infrastructure sector.

title: For Every Bottle Of Killer Cough Syrup Doctor Prescribed, He Got Rs 2.5 As Cut
content: How would you price the life of a child? How would you assess its worth? For the doctor who prescribed the cough syrup to most of the 23 children who died after having it in Madhya Pradesh, the answer was simple: Rs 2.54.

title: Ex Union Minister, 2 Deputy Chief Ministers In BJP Bihar List, Speaker Out
content: The BJP has released its first list of 71 candidates for the upcoming Bihar election. Deputy Chief Ministers Samrat Chaudhary and Vijay Kumar Sinha have been fielded from Tarapur and Lakhisarai seats, respectively

title: A Laptop Roadblock As Chandigarh Cops Probe IPS Officer's Suicide
content: The investigation into Haryana IPS officer Y Puran Kumar's death by suicide has hit a roadblock: his laptop. While Chandigarh police insist that the officer's laptop is necessary for the probe, Kumar's wife has refused to hand it over

title: Opinion: Opinion | Visits Aside, Will UK Ever Apologise To India?
content: Each time an Indian leader visits Britain, the question resurfaces: will London ever say sorry? Each time, it sidesteps, offering instead the language of "regret".

title: Andhra Mountaineer Becomes First Indian To Scale Nine 8,000-Metre Peaks
content: Bharath Thammineni, a 36-year old mountaineer from Kurnool in Andhra Pradesh, on Tuesday became the first Indian to summit all nine of the world's 14 highest peaks.

title: Late Payment Charges On Water Bills In Delhi To Be Waived Off Till Jan 31
content: In a major relief for Delhi residents, Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Tuesday announced a complete waiver of water bill late payment surcharges running into over Rs 11,000 crore for domestic consumption till January 31 next year.

title: Water Crisis At South Delhi's 2 Iconic Malls? What Authorities Said
content: DLF clarified that two of its malls - DLF Promenade and DLF Emporio - are fully functional, denying claims that they might face closure amid the festive season owing to water supply issues.

title: Tata Motors Share Price Dropped By 40%, But Why You Should Not Worry
content: Tata Motors shares nosedived on Tuesday, showing a nearly 40 per cent drop in value as the stock started trading ex-demerger.

title: Opinion: Opinion | US-China Trade War Has Turned Into A Full-Blown Siege, And India Is Stuck
content: Beijing's export controls, timed before diplomacy, reveal insecurity more than strength. By weaponising minerals, China has reminded the world why diversification is destiny.

title: Defer SIR In Maharashtra Until Local Body Elections: State Poll Body
content: The State Election Commission (SEC), in its letter dated September 9, stated that officials will be busy conducting the elections to local bodies.

title: Madhya Pradesh Cops Make 50-50 Deal With Hawala Operator. Then This Happens
content: Five police personnel, including a senior woman officer, were arrested after Chief Minister Mohan Yadav took a tough stand.

title: Bihar polls: BJP fields dy CM Sinha from Lakhisarai; speaker dropped from 1st list - key points

title: NBA big-three tiers: Ranking core trios for all 30 teams
content: Iman Shumpert is looking forward to seeing how the Thunder respond after winning the title . looking at the top three players on each roster is a good way to measure the short- and long-term health of an organization . we have laid out the cores of all 30 NBA teams .

title: 14 can't-miss games to watch this November
content: it's a new era of sorts in examining the nonconference portion of the men's college basketball season . a diminished slate of traditional MTEs along with ever-expanding league schedules have combined to change the cadence of marquee matchups . the Big East has done away with both the Gavitt Games (vs. Big Ten) and a mini-challenge against the Big 12 .

title: Bijan Robinson fuels Falcons in MNF win against Bills
content: the Falcons beat the Buffalo Bills 24-14 at Mercedes-Benz Stadium . the team is the only team to do it more than once since the 1970 merger . it was the first time the team had 150 yards and a touchdown as teammates in their careers .

title: 'Trinidad Magic': Meet the Ole Miss breakout QB even his teammates hadn't heard of
content: the spring transfer portal opened for division II football players in April . co-offensive coordinator Charlie Weis Jr. was glued to the computer screen in his office . "we better get Coach Kiffin," one of them said .

title: 📈 CFB Power Rankings: Indiana climbs into top 3
content: Oklahoma can still make the playoffs even with a loss to Texas . Ohio State allowed a whopping 16 points at Illinois, seven more than it had in any other game this season . the most dominant team is looking for areas to improve as the midpoint of 2025 season arrives .
